intro: Zieria odorifera subsp. odorifera, commonly known as the sweet zieria, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including insects and birds. Zieria odorifera subsp. odorifera is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
